The Rapid Blaster Deco is nearly identical in appearance to the Rapid Blaster. The only difference between the two is that the Rapid Blaster Deco has stickers bearing the Deco logo on the sides.

In Splatoon 3, the pink color that was present on the Rapid Blaster has been changed to blue.

The Rapid Blaster Deco comes in a set with Suction Bombs and the Bomb Rush.

- The Rapid Blaster Deco is a middleweight weapon.

- Each shot consumes 8% of the ink tank capacity.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When firing continuously, it shoots a bullet every 35 frames (1.71 shots per second).

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.62 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 20 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Each shot has a base damage of 80.

- Shots travel straight for 11 frames.

- Shots have a radius of 2 units.

- Shots cannot ever deviate from the inner reticle while on the ground.

- The angle its shots can deviate while in the air is 10 degrees.

- The outer reticle immediately expands after jumping. The outer reticle will finish shrinking after 60 frames.

- When jumping, the chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle is immediately set to 40%.

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 12 units per frame for 11 frames. Shots travel straight for 132 distance units.

- Ink droplets occur every 15.4 units.

- The frequency at which ink drips from a shot occurs at a rate of 10 droplets per shot.

- There are a total of 1 different droplet patterns that can be created while firing this weapon.

- Droplets that occur within 11 units of the player have a radius of 19.2 units.

- Droplets that occur when they travel past 200 units of the player have a radius of 18 units.

- All other ink droplets have a radius of 11 units.

- The shot explodes 15 frames after being fired.

- The far damage radius of the explosion is 35 units.

- When the shot explodes on the ground or wall, the far damage radius is 17.5 units.

- The near damage radius of the explosion is 5 units.

- Damage from the explosion scales from 25 at the far damage radius to 80 at the near damage radius.

- When the shot explodes on the ground or wall, the damage scales from 12.5 at the far damage radius to 40 at the near damage radius.

- When the shot explodes in the air, it creates a splash of paint with a radius of 28 units.

- The wall impact painting radius is 17 units.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

[1]

- ▲ Fire rate when firing from a Squid state: 17 frames → 12 frames.

- ▲ Recovery time after firing: 26 frames → 20 frames.

- ▲ Special gauge loss: 50% → 40%.

- ▲ Movement speed while firing increased by about 12%.

As you can likely guess, the Rapid Blaster Deco is just a Rapid Blaster that's been, well, decorated!
This version comes with Suction Bombs, which are great for forcing sneaky foes out into the open.
And with the Bomb Rush special, you'll be able to toss those bombs to your heart's content!
(NA)

The Rapid Blaster Deco was released on 27 January 2018 at 02:00 UTC.[2] It comes with Suction Bombs and the Inkjet.

- The Rapid Blaster Deco is a middleweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 167. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- The ink consumption of 7% and ink tank capacity of 100% allows players to fire 14 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When initially firing the weapon in humanoid form, the first shot takes 12 frames to come out.

- When firing from swim form, the first shot takes 21 frames to come out.

- The interval between firing and when the player is able to enter swim form or use a sub weapon is 20 frames.

- When firing continuously, it shoots a bullet every 35 frames (1.71 shots per second).

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.55 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 50 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Each shot has a base damage of 85.

- The bullet hitbox has a radius of 2 units.

- Shots cannot ever deviate from the inner reticle while on the ground.

- The angle its shots can deviate while in the air is 8 degrees.

- The outer reticle immediately expands after jumping. After 40 frames, the outer reticle will start shrinking, and will finish shrinking after 70 frames.

- When jumping, the chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle is immediately set to 50%.

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 12 units per frame for 11 frames. Shots travel straight for 132 distance units.
After that, the shot's velocity is set to 11.3305 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and decreases further as it travels.

- After that, the shot's velocity is set to 11.3305 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and decreases further as it travels.

- Ink droplets occur every 16.2 units.

- The frequency at which ink drips from a shot occurs at a rate of 11 droplets per shot.

- There are a total of 1 different droplet patterns that can be created while firing this weapon.

- Ink droplets have a radius of 11 units.

- Droplets have their radius multiplied by a value ranging from 1 if they fell from a height above 100 units to 1.2 if they fell from a height below 30 units.

- The shot explodes 15 frames after being fired.

- The far damage radius of the explosion is 33 units.
Main Power Up increases the far damage radius up to 35 units.

- Main Power Up increases the far damage radius up to 35 units.

- When the shot explodes on the ground or wall, the far damage radius is 16.5 units.

- The near damage radius of the explosion is 9.4 units.
Main Power Up increases the near damage radius up to 10 units.

- Main Power Up increases the near damage radius up to 10 units.

- Damage from the explosion is 35. Damage does not change based on distance from the center of the explosion.

- When the shot explodes on the ground or wall, the damage is 17.5.

- When the shot explodes in the air, it creates a splash of paint with a radius of 28 units.

- The radius of wall dripping paint is 10 units.

- The wall impact painting radius is 19 units.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- After that, the shot's velocity is set to 11.3305 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and decreases further as it travels.

- Main Power Up increases the far damage radius up to 35 units.

- Main Power Up increases the near damage radius up to 10 units.

[3][4]

- ▼ Decreased radius of damage dealt by exploding shots by roughly 6%: 35 units → 33 units.

- ▼ Special points: 180 → 190.

- ▲ The Main Power Up gear ability will now also increase the radius of explosions while equipped when using these main weapons.
The above effect will be maxed out when 2.9 times the normal amount of gear ability is equipped.
Each additional gear ability is worth 0.3 of the effect of the base gear ability.

- Each additional gear ability is worth 0.3 of the effect of the base gear ability.

- The above effect will be maxed out when 2.9 times the normal amount of gear ability is equipped.

- Each additional gear ability is worth 0.3 of the effect of the base gear ability.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to the Rainmaker barrier by roughly 11%: 1.9x → 2.1x.

The Rapid Blaster Deco is a decorated version of the Rapid Blaster. The stats are the same as the Rapid Blaster, but combined with the Suction Bombs, it's a great weapon for pushing forward. You can also use the Inkjet to draw your opponents' attention! Recommended for players who value offense and defense equally!

The Rapid Blaster Deco returns in Splatoon 3 as of Fresh Season 2023. It functions the same as the normal Rapid Blaster but has a different kit and appearance. It has Deco arrow stickers on the sides and a blue color scheme, as opposed to the traditional red one. Its kit consists of Torpedo and Inkjet. The weapon was teased in the Fresh Season poster on 16 February 2023 and officially revealed on 21 February 2023. It released on 28 February 2023.

- ▼ Points to fill special gauge: 200 → 210.

- ▲ Reduced the amount of time it takes for ink to begin recovering after firing by about 1/20th of a second: 50 frames → 47 frames.

The Rapid Blaster Deco is a cool, decorated version of the Rapid Blaster. Not that the original isn't cool! You'll have to decide for yourself which one you like better. Maybe the overall loadout will help you make the choice! This one comes with the Torpedo sub to help make up for the main weapon's somewhat low attack power. And for those moments when you want to breach the front lines, you've got the Inkjet special! Not a bad little surprise to keep in your back pocket. This is a versatile set that can really shine with the right user, so I hope you get a chance to try it out!

The difference between the versions of the Rapid Blaster: The Rapid Blaster Deco does not illuminate when fired.  (link to file)

For competitive tips about the Rapid Blaster Deco

- The Rapid Blaster Deco is listed in the "Coming Soon" section of the Splatoon Prima Guide, even though it was available at launch. This could mean that it was originally intended to be a DLC item.

- In Splatoon 3, the Rapid Blaster have lights which illuminate when fired. But for some reason, these light-up parts on the Rapid Blaster Deco do not light up by any means. This issue is shared with the Rapid Blaster Pro Deco.
